title.as: agreed to by house and senate

titles.title: A bill to authorize appropriations for the Coast Guard, and for other purposes.
A bill to amend the White Mountain Apache Tribe Water Rights Quantification Act of 2010 to clarify the use of amounts in the WMAT Settlement Fund.
Frank LoBiondo Coast Guard Authorization Act of 2018
Federal Maritime Commission Authorization Act of 2017

action.text: Introduced in Senate
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator Hoeven without amendment. With written report No. 115-7.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 20.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Power and Oceans.
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on Water, Power and Oceans Discharged.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 115-441.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 326.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 681 Reported to House. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. The amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-54 shall be considered as adopted
Rule H. Res. 681 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 681.

Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. The amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-54 shall be considered as adopted.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S. 140.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

vote.text: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 239 - 173 (Roll no. 11).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Motion by Senator McConnell to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 made in Senate.
Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 presented in Senate.
Motion by Senator McConnell to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with an amendment (SA 2227) made in Senate.

Motion by Senator McConnell to refer to Senate Committee on Indian Affairs the House message to accompany S. 140 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 2229) made in Senate.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
Cloture on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 not invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 55 - 41. Record Vote Number: 74.

Motion by Senator McConnell to refer to Senate Committee on Indian Affairs the House message to accompany S. 140 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 2229) tabled in Senate by Voice Vote.
Motion to table the motion by Senator McConnell to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with an amendment (SA 2227) agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Motion by Senator McConnell to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with an amendment (SA 2232) made in Senate.
Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with an amendment (SA 2232) presented in Senate.

Motion by Senator McConnell to refer to Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation the House message to accompany S. 140 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 2234) made in Senate.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
Cloture on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with an amendment (SA 2232) not invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 56 - 42. Record Vote Number: 77.

Motion by Senator McConnell to reconsider the vote by which cloture on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with an amendment (SA 2232) was not invoked (Record Vote No. 77) entered in Senate.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).

Motion by Senator McConnell to refer to Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation the House message to accompany S. 140 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 2234) withdrawn in Senate.
Motion by Senator McConnell to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with the following amendment (SA 2232) withdrawn in Senate.
Motion by Senator McConnell to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 withdrawn in Senate.
Motion by Senator McConnell to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with the following amendment (SA 4054) made in Senate.
Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with the following amendment (SA 4054) presented in Senate.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).
Cloture on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 140 with the following amendment (SA 4054 as modified) invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 93 - 5. Record Vote Number: 240.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).

vote.text: Senate concurred in the House amendment to S. 140 with an amendment (SA 4054 as modified) by Yea-Nay Vote. 94 - 6. Record Vote Number: 241.

action.text: Pursuant to the provisions of S. Con. Res. 51, enrollment corrections on S. 140 have been made.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Shuster moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment to S. 140.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment Agreed to by voice vote.

reference.label: text as House agreed to Senate Amendment

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(Sec. 1) This bill amends the White Mountain Apache Tribe Water Rights Quantification Act of 2010 to specify that settlement funds may be used for the planning, design, and construction of the tribe's rural water system in Arizona.
(Sec. 2) The bill amends the Act of August 9, 1955, commonly known as the Long-Term Leasing Act, to allow the Ohkay Owingeh pueblo and the pueblo of Santa Clara in New Mexico to lease their restricted fee tribal land (land that is owned by a tribe and has restrictions against alienation and taxation) for up to 99 years. Under current law, they may lease the lands for up to 25 years.
(Sec. 3) The bill amends the National Labor Relations Act (NLRA) to exclude Native American tribes and tribal enterprises and institutions on tribal land from requirements for employers under the NLRA. (Currently under the NLRA, employers may not engage in unfair labor practices and must allow employees to form unions, engage in collective bargaining, and take collective action.)
